a.n: Mozart on Tour - Episode 9 : Vienna and Prague

p.k: The 13-part Mozart on Tour series chronicles the journey of Mozart across Europe. Both soloist and conductor, Andre Previn performs with the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra Mozart's Piano Concerto No. 24, KV 491.
p.d: The 13-part Mozart on Tour series chronicles the journey of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart across Europe. Mozart's Le nozze di Figaro asks basic questions about the relationships of men and women, the aristocracy and their servants, and is, to this day, the most mature and genuine human operatic composition ever written. With sublimely beautiful music that supports, intensifies, and enhances the drama every step of the way, the Piano Concerto No. 24, KV 491 is solid drama from start to finish, with a minor harmonic structure reminiscent of Don Giovanni. In this performance, recorded at Schönbrunn palace in Vienna, Andre Previn is the soloist and conductor of the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra.
